alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 8:58AM CDT until May 09 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PHILLIPS...WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN...SOUTHWESTERN PHELPS...SOUTHEASTERN FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 858 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Loomis to near Oxford to 8 miles south of Wilsonville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Oxford and Stamford around 905 AM CDT. Atlanta around 915 AM CDT. Orleans around 925 AM CDT. Alma, Huntley and Ragan around 945 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
